othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Explains the architecture and power flow of a redundant Bruce UPS system using a 2-pole manual bypass switch and both static switches for load transfer.

messagepanel.howtoavoid: When the manual bypass switch is in Bypass position, there is no backup from the battery it is not possible for the system to automatically switch back to inverter operation in case the bypass mains becomes unavailable.

div.p:
A manual bypass switch is used to isolate sections for maintenance while supplying the load from the bypass mains. A 2-position manual bypass switch have the positions: In Normal position the system can automatically switch between normal operation and bypass operation without interruption.
Bypass position is used to isolate sections for maintenances or troubleshooting.

conbody.p: The static switch EN makes it possible to switch over to bypass operation automatically without interruption.

The static switch EA is used to help isolate the system in bypass operation, so there is no feedback from the static bypass to the inverter. It also makes the switch between the inverter and bypass more controlled.
